please note that the above measurements are estimated to the nearest 0 5cm or 0 25 inches and are finished garment measurements sleeve and body length are adjustable page4 of 9 copyright © kate harvie all rights reserved for personal use only 13 august 2024 pattern instructions note on changing yarns in this garment you will work with two strands of dk yarn at a time you can change yarn as often as you want depending on what you have available you should not change both strands of yarn at the same place you can swap in and out from one colour to another over the course of several row for a more variegated look carrying the colour you are not using up the back of your work when you start or finish a ball of yarn work it along with the other two strands for three or four stitches then snip off the loose end this saves a lot of sewing in later and is barely noticeable if you want your left and right fronts to match either side of the front neck make sure you don t use all the yarn of a particular colour on the first side don t ask me how i know this… similarly if you want your sleeves to be symmetrical make sure you set aside enough yarn for the second sleeve when working the first i recommend choosing the same two colours for the ribs at hem sleeves and neckband but this is entirely up to you cast on work body using smaller long circular needle two strands of dk yarn and the cast-on method of your choice cast on 88 92 96 100 104 108 112 120 sts pm and join for working in the round taking care not to twist your work round 1 k1 p1 to end of round check again that work is not twisted and continue in k1 p1 rib until work measures 4cm/1 5 in or desired depth of rib change to larger needle and continue in st st every round k until work measures 19 19 5 20 21 22 25 5 28 29 5 cm 7 5 7 75 8 8 25 8 75 10 11 11 5 in from cast-on edge or desired length to underarm divide for front and back work upper back remove
